title: Sound Fonts?
content:
I just want to ask for recomendations on where i can get some good, free soundfonts. I will be using .mod or .xm format in MilkyTracker (idk if all soundfonts r compatible, i know little about them--in fact, i've never used them b4 [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img] )--------
Keen wears his watch on his RIGHT wrist... Is he left handed? Nope, he shoots with his right hand too.

"Dear Mother, I can't believe what happened today! I met one of the smartest people in the whole Universe! His IQ is three f...
Hold on, Mother. Something strange is happening...
6234yuweyudfhjgfklgmm,/.,"

title: Re: Sound Fonts?
content:
I use a great and small (20 MB) soundfont called Musica Theoria.
Some searching on Google should wield you a free, fast download somewhere, without having to register. Will take a while, but I don't feel like finding the page again. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

Actually, I don't know how good the soundfont is for module tracking, I haven't used it for that yet, but as a MIDI software synth replacement it's PERFECT. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

By the way, SF2 and DLS soundfonts are always compatible with Modplug Tracker, though the instruments won't always sound as good or intended. Sometimes you also need to unpack the files from .sfpack or .sfark files.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].
